result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sophie Alicia Miller

defendant.name: Miller, Sophie Alicia
defendant.address: 13922 W Signor St, Stone Lake, WI 54876

records.addlTxt: Uploaded warrant document to ShareFile and sent paper copy to Sheriff's Department.  No warrant card generated.

11:47 AM Defendant Sophie Alicia Miller not in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Sophie Alicia Miller.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Richards makes a comment on DEF non appearance. State requests warrant for Sawyer and surrounding counties. Court orders Statewide warrant and requests for bond forfeiture proceedings to begin.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

DEF must take all medication as prescribed by physician.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options. 

Attny Richards to set cases with JA.

Atty Richards indicates DEF  waives prelim.  Court advised the DEF as to her right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived her right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.

8:47 AM Defendant Sophie Alicia Miller appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Sophie Alicia Miller.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Court enters NG Plea to Count 2.   Moves to waiver of preliminary hearing.   Attny Richards makes bond modification request.  State stands mute.   Court amends bond to SIBS $2500   DEF must take all medication as prescribed by physician.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
